intro: Ditassa castellana, commonly known as the Castilian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
